means: 放荡不羁的人，淫荡的人

sentence.Network_en: The transition from libertine to prig was so complete.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个酒徒色鬼竟然摇身一变就成了道学先生.

sentence.Network_en: I believe John is not a libertine any more.
sentence.Network_cn: 我相信约翰不再是个浪子了.

sentence.Network_en: I lost Ruth and gained an undeserved reputation as a potential libertine.
sentence.Network_cn: 我失去了露丝,却冤枉地担上了准浪子的名声.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 【考研单词速记】（私） ... liberty n. 自由，自由权；特权 【形】 libertine 浪子 1400 entertainment n. 招待,款待;表演文娱节目 7775.
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... liberation n 解放；释放 libertine n 浪荡子 illiberal a 吝啬的；粗鄙的.
英语词汇的奥秘 ... landgravine 伯爵夫人 libertine 放荡的人 concubine 妾，姘妇.
词根及词缀 ... philistine n 市侩 libertine n 放荡者 doctrine n 教条，教义.

list.abs: i ' m unclean , a libertine ., 我不干净 , 一个玩乐.
英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(L) ... libertine 放荡者 libertinism 放荡 Liberty Bell 独立钟.
英语课程_自学英语... ... unruliness n. 无法无天, 任性, 难驾驽 libertinism n. 放荡, 玩乐, 自由思想 bestow vt. 授予, 利用.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting a freed slave or the son of one): from Latin libertinus 'freedman', from liber 'free'. In the mid 16th cent., imitating French libertin, the term denoted a member of any of various antinomian sects in France; hence sense 2

entry.tran: 登徒子；浪荡子；好色之徒
entry.def: If you refer to someone as a libertine, you mean that they are sexually immoral and do not care about the effect their behaviour has on other people.

example.tran: 自认是懦夫、登徒子和无赖的人

means.word_mean: 1. a dissolute person; usually a man who is morally unrestrained

auth_sentence.content: His French lawyers said Strauss-Kahn is being hounded for his libertine ways.
auth_sentence.res_content: His French lawyers said Strauss-Kahn is being hounded for his libertine ways.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His French lawyers said Strauss-Kahn is being hounded for his libertine ways.

auth_sentence.content: The intellectual libertine who denies everything that cannot be certified by the senses.
auth_sentence.res_content: The intellectual libertine who denies everything that cannot be certified by the senses.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The intellectual libertine who denies everything that cannot be certified by the senses.

auth_sentence.content: Most importantly, it is time for all the free-market, libertine, conservatives to put their money where their mouth is.
auth_sentence.res_content: Most importantly, it is time for all the free-market, libertine, conservatives to put their money where their mouth is.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Most importantly, it is time for all the free-market, libertine, conservatives to put their money where their mouth is.

liber自由+t+ine人→自由之人→浪荡子
